MODULE.name: RhoConnectClient
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: is used for syncronization with Rhoconnect servers. Synchronization overview is avalable here: http://docs.rhomobile.com/rhodes/synchronization

PROPERTIES.DESC: These properties are used to configure RhoConnectClient global behavior or retreiving current configuration parameters.

PROPERTY.name: userName
PROPERTY.DESC: Current username of the RhoConnectClient session if isLoggedIn is true, otherwise returns the last logged in username.

PROPERTY.name: pollInterval
PROPERTY.DESC: Sync poll interval in seconds. Setting this to 0 will disable polling-based sync. Sync process will be triggered automatically according to this setting.

PROPERTY.name: pageSize
PROPERTY.DESC: Page size for RhoConnectClient. Default size is 2000.

PROPERTY.name: threadedMode
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets if RhoConnectClient will work in a separate thread. If true then calls to login, doSync, doSyncSource and search will perform asynchronously without delaying calling thread. Results should be handled in provided callbacks. If false, all calls are blocking and resuls are returned directly from method calls. Default is true.

PROPERTY.name: showStatusPopup
PROPERTY.DESC: Enable or disable show status popup.

PROPERTY.name: sslVerifyPeer
PROPERTY.DESC: Enable or disable verification of RhoConnect ssl certificates, true by default.

METHOD.name: isLoggedIn
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if the RhoConnectClient currently has a user session, false if not.

RETURN.DESC: True if have logged in user session, false if not.

METHOD.name: isSyncing
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if sync is currently in progress.

RETURN.DESC: True if sync has started but not finished yet, false otherwise

METHOD.name: search
METHOD.DESC: If you have a large dataset in your backend service, you don't have to synchronize everything with the RhoConnectClient. Instead you can filter the synchronized dataset using the RhoConnectClient's search function. Provide callback, which will be executed after search is completed.

PARAM.name: args
PARAM.DESC: Hash of arguments passed to search

PARAM.name: sourceNames
PARAM.DESC: Array of source names to be included in search result.

PARAM.name: searchParams
PARAM.DESC: Hash of key-value pairs to be included in search result.

PARAM.name: maxResults
PARAM.DESC: Maximum number of results to be returned.

RETURN.DESC: Will return value only if threadedMode set to false. Otherwise search results returned in callback.

PARAM.name: status
PARAM.DESC: Resulting status of search. 'ok' of completed successfully, 'error' otherwise.

PARAM.name: search_params
PARAM.DESC: search_params originally provided for the search call. Typically you want to forward the original search_params to your view that displays the results so you can perform the same query locally. Please see examples section.

METHOD.name: doSync
METHOD.DESC: Start the SyncEngine process and display an optional status popup.

PARAM.name: showStatusPopup
PARAM.DESC: Set to true to show status popup.

PARAM.name: queryParams
PARAM.DESC: Params to be passed to server.

PARAM.name: syncOnlyChangedSources
PARAM.DESC: Sync only sources that have local changes.

METHOD.name: doSyncSource
METHOD.DESC: Start sync for a given source name.

PARAM.name: showStatusPopup
PARAM.DESC: Set to true to show status popup.

PARAM.name: queryParams
PARAM.DESC: Params to be passed to server.

METHOD.name: login
METHOD.DESC: Authenticates the user with RhoConnect. The callback will be executed when it is finished.

METHOD.name: logout
METHOD.DESC: Logout the user from the RhoConnect server. This removes the local user session.

METHOD.name: stopSync
METHOD.DESC: Stops any sync operations currently in progress.

METHOD.name: setNotification
METHOD.DESC: The RhoConnectClient system uses notifications to provide information about the sync process to a Rhodes application. Notifications can be setup once for the duration of runtime or each time a sync is triggered. One a sync is processing for a model, notifications are called with parameters containing sync process state. Your application can use this information to display different wait pages, progress bars, etc. setNotification will set notification for a model.

PARAM.name: sourceName
PARAM.DESC: Source name for which notification will be enabled. Use '*' to set notification for all models.

METHOD.name: clearNotification
METHOD.DESC: Clears the sync notification for a given source

METHOD.name: setObjectNotification
METHOD.DESC: The RhoConnectClient can send a notification when a specific object on the current page has been modified. This is useful if you have frequently-changing data like feeds or timelines in your application and want them to update without the user taking any action.

METHOD.name: addObjectNotify
METHOD.DESC: Add the object notification by passing in an object ID

METHOD.name: getLastSyncObjectCount
METHOD.DESC: Returns number of synced objects for a given source.

METHOD.name: setSourceProperty
METHOD.DESC: Sets property value for a given source.

METHOD.name: getSourceProperty
METHOD.DESC: Gets property value for a given source.

REMARK.title: Backround synchronization on iOS
REMARK.DESC: On iOS, if application is put to background, it will be suspended. To allow application finish sync after application goes to background, you can use 'finish_sync_in_background' parameter in rhoconfig.txt. When this parameter is set to '1', if sync is active in the time of background transition ( e.g. started from app_deactivate handler ), application will not be suspended until sync is finished.

EXAMPLE.title: Sync Authentication
EXAMPLE.DESC: Call login method and then handle login result in provided callback.

SECTION.DESC: When RhoConnectClient.login completes, the callback declared is executed and receives parameters including success or failure and error messages (if any).
SECTION.CODE:
def login_callback error_code = @params['error_code'].to_i if error_code == 0 # run sync if we were successful WebView.navigate Rho::RhoConfig.options_path RhoConnectClient.doSync else if error_code == Rho::RhoError::ERR_CUSTOMSYNCSERVER @msg = @params['error_message'] end
if not @msg or @msg.length == 0 @msg = Rho::RhoError.new(error_code).message end
WebView.navigate( url_for(:action => :login, :query => {:msg => @msg}) ) end end
